clinical_study.brief_title: Physical Exercise for Prevention of Dementia
clinical_study.official_title: Physical Exercise and Prevention of Cognitive Decline in Subjects at Risk of Dementia: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The principal aim of this study is to verify whether a program of supervised, multimodal physical exercise improves cognitive function and/or reduces the rate of cognitive decline in older adults

detailed_description.textblock: Community-dwelling volunteers, recruited from social centers, were invited to an in-person assessment that included a medical history questionnaire and examination, anthropometric measurements, blood tests for cardiovascular risk, and several outcome measures. Participants meeting the inclusion criteria were divided in 3 groups (participants without subjective or objective cognitive impairment, with subjective memory complaints and with mild cognitive impairments) and randomly assigned (1:1) to an experimental group or a control group, using a list of random numbers generated by a statistical software. The list was kept in a sealed envelope and a researcher, not directly involved in the recruitment and in the evaluation of the participants, assigned the allocation numbers.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) score from baseline to 48 months
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6-12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of neuropsychological test battery from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months
secondary_outcome.description: It includes: Frontal Assessment Battery, Rey's Auditory Verbal Learning Test, Prose Memory, Stroop Color Word Interference Test, Attentive Matrices, Raven's Progressive Matrices, Trial Making Test, designs copying with and without programming models.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Short-form Health Survey (SF-36) from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Memory Complaint Questionnaire (MAC-Q) from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Physical Activity Scale for the Elderly (PASE) from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of AAHPERD (American Alliance for Health, Physical Education, Recreation and Dance) fitness test battery from baseline to 48 months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months

other_outcome.measure: Change of Composite cognitive score (CCS) from baseline to 48 months
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 6 -12 months, over an intervention period of 48 months
other_outcome.description: It is calculated by averaging the standardized scores (Z-score) of all neuropsychological tests, for assessing the overall changes in cognitive performance.

intervention.description: Supervised, multimodal physical activity including aerobic, resistance and stretching exercises
Usual physical activity, generally consisting in long walks and/or stretching, toning and/or balance exercises, or posture education

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Age > 50 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Medical conditions that compromise survival or limit physical activity
- Geriatric Depression Scale-15 score of 6 or higher
- Alcohol intake > 4 units/day
- Mini- Mental State Examination < 24
- Clinical Dementia Rating score of 1 or more
